intro: Crassula scabra var. minor, commonly known as the Wooly Crassula, is a succulent plant native to South Africa. It features dense, woolly foliage that gives it a distinctive, fuzzy appearance. The leaves are typically green with a bluish tint and are arranged in a rosette pattern. It produces small, star-shaped flowers in shades of pink or white during the warmer months. This plant is well-suited for rock gardens or as a container plant due to its compact size and low maintenance requirements.
